{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-07-30 19:47:41","updatedTime":"2020-07-30 11:47:41","title":"How to Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\"><p>A vertical garden is an excellent way to upcycle an old bookshelf! If you’re jonesing for a fun and functional creative project, make it your own by painting the bookshelf and adding any other special touches. You can keep it inside or outside depending on where you want to showcase your favorite plants. However, if you’re going for an outdoor vertical garden, be sure to check your USDA plant hardiness zone so you know your plants will stay happy and healthy.\n</p>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden&#38;action=edit&#38;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden&#38;action=edit&#38;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Cleaning and Sanding the Bookshelf\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cleaning-and-Sanding-the-Bookshelf\">Cleaning and Sanding the Bookshelf</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Choose a hardwood or metal bookshelf you don't use anymore. If you recently found a bookshelf or want to upcycle your own, it might be perfect for your vertical garden! Try to pick one with at least 3 or 4 evenly-spaced shelves so you can fit lots of planters on each tier.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-01.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 01.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-01.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-01.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>If you want to have tall plants, make sure the shelves are far enough apart to allow them to grow upward without hitting the shelf above.</li>\n<li>Check to make sure the shelves and sides don’t show signs of rotting, cracks, or wobbly screws.</li>\n<li>Wooden bookshelves do better inside so the wood doesn’t deteriorate from rain or harsh weather. However, you can waterproof it with a sealant so it stays in tip-top shape.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Scrub down the bookshelf with a damp microfiber towel or sponge. For a hardwood shelf, spray a little water onto each shelf and wipe them down with a microfiber cloth. For a metal shelf, dampen a sponge, pour  of white vinegar onto it, and use that to rub the shelves clean. Put some elbow grease into it to get as much of the dust and grime off of the shelves and sides as you can.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-02.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 02.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-02.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-02.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>For a lustrous finish on a metal bookshelf, rub on some stainless steel polish with a soft rag.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Sand down a hardwood bookshelf if you want to paint it. Use a 150, 180, or 220-grit sanding block to get the shelves smooth to the touch. Hold the block firmly in your hand and move it back and forth along the grain (not side to side) with even pressure. Wipe away the dust when you're done.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-03.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 03.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/78/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-03.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-03.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>If you don't have a sanding block, you can also cut a rectangle of sandpaper and wrap it around a small piece of wood.</li>\n<li>If you have an electric sander, follow the directions in the instruction booklet about how to load it and use it safely.</li>\n<li>A metal bookcase usually doesn’t need to be sanded. However, a good sanding or scrub-down with steel wool can get rid of any rusty spots.</li></ul></li></ol>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden&#38;action=edit&#38;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Priming and Painting The Bookshelf\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Priming-and-Painting-The-Bookshelf\">Priming and Painting The Bookshelf</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Apply acrylic primer if you’re painting it with acrylic paint or keeping it outdoors. Grains of the wood can show through the final coat of paint later on, so use an acrylic primer to ensure your paint job looks great and lasts a long time. Apply it in long, even strokes with a wide paint brush and let it dry for at least 4 hours before adding your first coat of paint.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-04.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 04.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-04.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-04.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>You can find priming spray at any home improvement or hardware store in the same aisle as the paint-on primer.</li>\n<li>You don’t have to use a primer if you’re keeping your bookshelf inside, but it’ll help the acrylic paint stay on longer without chipping.</li>\n<li>If you want to stain the wood with a wood stain like oak, mahogany, or chestnut, apply the wood stain first and then paint or spray on the primer to lock it in.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Paint the bookshelf with at least 2 coats of acrylic or water-based latex paint. Apply the paint in long, even strokes with a wide paintbrush or roller brush. Wait at least 4 hours for the first coat to dry before adding a second coat. If you’d rather use spray paint, move to a well-ventilated area and put on a mask. Shake the canister and hold it  away from the wood. Spray the first coat on in long, even strokes then wait 4 to 6 hours to do another coat. It may take a while, but it’ll be worth it for a customized bookshelf garden!<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-05.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 05.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-05.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-05.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Feel free to get creative with stencils if you’re using spray paint and want to add some artful touches to your bookshelf. Use a floral stencil to go with a garden theme or use stencil lettering to write your name, words of encouragement, or your favorite quote onto the side of the shelf—the possibilities are endless!</li>\n<li>Choose warm colors like red, orange, or yellow to make the green leaves on your plants stand out. Or, you can choose deep red, purple, blue, or green to make it look calm and inviting. Bright white paint is a good choice if you want it to look clean and minimalist.</li>\n<li>Consider painting the vertical backs and sides of each shelf a different color from the rest of the wood to add some character and depth. For instance, you might paint the backs and sides of each interior shelf a soft white and make the rest of the wood baby blue.</li>\n<li>Be sure to paint or spray paint outdoors or in a well-ventilated room and put down some newspaper or a tarp to protect nearby surfaces.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Wait at least 4 to 6 hours for the paint to dry completely. After the final coat is on, check the time so you know when you’re ready to start gathering or potting your plants. If the bookshelf is inside, open a nearby window or set up a fan to help the paint dry faster.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-06.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 06.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-06.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-06.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>The paint will be dry to the touch after just 1 or 2 hours, but it may still be prone to chipping or smudging so it’s better to wait a full 4 to 6 hours.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Protect a wooden outdoor bookshelf with a waterproof sealant. After the paint has dried completely, apply a water-based polycrylic sealant with a wide paintbrush. If you’re using sealant spray, hold the canister  away from the surface and spray it on in long, even strokes. Let it dry for at least 4 to 6 hours before you start to decorate the shelves with plants and other knick-knacks.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-07.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 07.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/65/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-07.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-07.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>You can buy polycrylic sealant from any home improvement or hardware store.</li>\n<li>The sealant will look a little cloudy at first, but it’ll dry clear to show off your beautiful paint job!</li>\n<li>You can also use an oil-based sealant like polyurethane but it’s not a great choice because it emits toxic fumes.</li></ul></li></ol>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden&#38;action=edit&#38;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Adding Plants\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Adding-Plants\">Adding Plants</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Place the bookshelf in a spot that gets at least 4-6 hours of sunlight. Put the vertical garden somewhere that works for most (if not all) of the plants’ needs. Pick a spot that’s spacious and easy to get to so you can water the plants when you need to. Make sure it's in an area that gets at least 4 to 6 hours of direct or indirect sunlight to keep your plants healthy and happy!<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-08.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 08.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-08.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-08.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>If you're putting it outside, don't put it near your driveway or a child's play area—anywhere with heavy foot traffic is a bad idea because it may accidentally get knocked over.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Install furniture anchoring hooks on either side of the shelf to hold it in place. Once your bookshelf is in place in front of a wall or fence, screw or nail furniture anchoring hooks or brackets into the wall behind the bookshelf on the left and right sides. Attach the other end of the anchoring hooks (at the end of each strap) to the back of the bookshelf either with nails or screws. The strap between the shelf and the wall should have very little slack so the bookshelf won’t wobble or topple over.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-09.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 09.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-09.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-09.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>There are different types of furniture anchoring kits so choose one that works for the material of your walls and the shelf (e.g., heavy-duty screws work best for cement board walls while nails will work for wood and drywall). You can buy them at any hardware or home improvement store.</li>\n<li>This is especially important if you live in an area with earthquakes or strong winds that might blow it over.</li>\n<li>If you're using a leaning bookshelf, definitely secure it to a wall!</li>\n<li>If you're keeping it inside or only putting a few small plants on it, it's okay to skip this step.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Choose plants that thrive in your climate or have similar water and light needs. If you're putting the bookshelf outside, look up your USDA hardiness zone to see which plants do best in your region. And no matter where you put them, take note of the temperature, light, and water the plants require so you know how to keep them healthy. It’s okay if they have slightly different watering needs but make sure the plants you choose all need the same amount and quality of light (i.e., direct or indirect) since they’ll be in close quarters.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Make sure the plants won't grow so tall that they hit the bottom of the shelf above.</li>\n<li>Succulents are great indoor or outdoor plants that are often pretty stout and easy to take care of.</li>\n<li>Herbs like rosemary, dill, cilantro, and basil are great additions to an indoor or outdoor bookshelf—plus you'll get to enjoy them on your favorite dishes!</li>\n<li>As an example, you might put some succulents and herbs on the top shelf, geraniums and begonias on the center shelves, and ferns or bromeliads on the bottom shelf.</li>\n<li>Avoid vining crops or flowers that need a trellis to grow—these include tomatoes, beans, peas, nasturtium, Mandevilla, trumpet creepers, morning glory, bougainvillea, black-eyed Susans, jasmine, and clematis.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Put the plants in small, well-draining pots filled with nutrient-dense potting soil. Either purchase, plant, or propagate the plants you want to put on your bookshelf. Go to your local garden supply store or nursery to buy starter plants if you'd rather not go through the hassle of germinating seeds and waiting for them to sprout.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Buying plants can be pricey, so look for special sales and buy smaller ones to save a few bucks.</li>\n<li>Most flowers and houseplants can be put in potting soil, but things like succulents and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants\" title=\"Propagate Air Plants\">air plants</a> need different types of soil (or none at all) to ensure the roots don't get too moist.</li>\n<li>If you're <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-Plants-from-Seed\" title=\"Grow Plants from Seed\">sowing the plant from a seed</a>, fill  containers with potting soil and stick the seed  into the soil (or however deep the seed packet specifies). Water them every day until you see sprouts. Once they're  tall, you can transfer them into larger pots.</li>\n<li>If you already have some plants you like, consider <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-Cuttings-from-Established-Plants\" title=\"Grow Cuttings from Established Plants\">propagating</a> them if possible. Pothos, prayer plants, African violets, gardenia, umbrella plants, rosemary, and philodendron are all super easy to propagate from cuttings.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Arrange the potted plants on the shelves with the heaviest at the bottom. Put the heaviest containers on the bottom shelf and the lightest ones on the top to help the bookcase stay level and sturdy. Be sure to leave some space between the plants so they're not too cramped and having to fight for sunlight.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>For example, say you have a large potted fern, a big rubber plant, a few medium-sized flowering plants, and some small herbs or cacti. Put the fern and the rubber plant on the bottom, the flowering ones on the middle shelves, and the small pots on top. However, if you have a flowering plant that needs more sunlight than the cacti (like a shasta daisy versus Thanksgiving or Easter cactus), swap them so each plant gets the light it needs.</li>\n<li>If you have trailing plants, put those on top so the leaves can hang down the sides and front of the bookcase.</li>\n<li>If a bottom shelf doesn't get as much light because of the way the bookshelf is facing, it's okay to put that plant on a higher shelf if it needs more light. Just make sure the bookcase is secured to a wall or fence so it doesn't topple over.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Hang small vertical planters onto the sides of the bookcase to maximize space. If you want your bookshelf garden to be bursting with beautiful greenery and blooms, stick vertical planters onto the sides. You can hammer nails into the sides to hang traditional vertical planters or use extra-strength tacky hooks.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-13.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Bromeliads (sky plants), Spanish moss, pink quills, and orchids are all beautiful air plants that will add a touch of tropical charm to your garden. Just make sure they're suitable for your USDA zone if the bookshelf is outside.</li>\n<li>Vines like pothos, ivy, philodendron, and wandering jew are perfect for draping down the sides of the bookshelf. Plus, they’ll thrive if you’re keeping the bookshelf inside where there’s only indirect lighting.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Decorate your bookshelf with lights, art, and any other trinkets. If the bookshelf is inside, feel free to put a small lamp on the top shelf to illuminate your lovely garden. If it’s outside, string outdoor twinkle lights around the top or along the shelves of the bookcase. Place picture frames, candles, decorative vases, jugs, small paintings, sculptures, or books on the shelf to add your own style.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Turn a Bookshelf Into a Vertical Garden Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-14.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>If you’re keeping it outside, don’t put anything on the shelf that can be damaged by water. Stick to stone sculptures and maybe some small pictures or art pieces in weatherproof frames or frames that you don’t care about getting damaged.</li>\n<li>You can also buy short strands of LED “fairy” lights to put on each shelf. Just make sure they’re suitable for outdoor use if your garden is outside.</li></ul></li></ol>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden&#38;action=edit&#38;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2>\n<ul><li>Use <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-Organic-Pesticides-for-Gardening\" title=\"Use Organic Pesticides for Gardening\">organic or natural pest repellants</a> to keep your plants healthy and bug-free!<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li>\n<li>Prune or deadhead blooming plants whenever you notice they’re wilted or dropping leaves.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li></ul>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden&#38;action=edit&#38;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2>\n<ul><li>Double check that the shelves are stable and that the whole bookshelf is situated in a safe, sturdy spot.</li>\n<li>If you have pets and are keeping your vertical garden indoors, make sure to choose non-toxic plants.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li>\n<li>Always put on a mask and goggles before you start standing wood. Never sand indoors because the wood dust can hang in the air long after you’re done and may cause respiratory problems.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup></li></ul>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden&#38;action=edit&#38;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Things You&#039;ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2>\n<ul><li>Bookshelf</li>\n<li>Water</li>\n<li>Microfiber cloth</li>\n<li>Sponge</li>\n<li>White vinegar</li>\n<li>Fine-grit sanding block (or sandpaper and small wooden block)</li>\n<li>Acrylic or water-based latex paint</li>\n<li>Wide paintbrush or roller brush</li>\n<li>Stabilizing hooks or furniture anchors</li>\n<li>Potted plants (or seeds, potting soil, and pots)</li>\n<li>Polycrylic sealant (optional, for an outdoor wooden bookcase)</li>\n<li>Small vertical planters (optional)</li>\n<li>Paint primer (optional)</li>\n<li>Wood stain (optional)</li>\n<li>Stainless steel polish (optional)</li></ul>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden&#38;action=edit&#38;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2><div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\"><ol +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-01.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-01.jpg","linkMd5":"8146b3ca839ce7227f574b5316b3fba9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn11@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596109662588_2eb933885aca8f39.webp","author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-01.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-01.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn11@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596109662588_2eb933885aca8f39.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-02.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-02.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn1@2020_2/2020-07-30/1596109674684_df0b8659282f0e58.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/78/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-03.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-03.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn70@2020_1/2020-07-30/1596109670886_a425b60db46605c4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-04.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-04.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn9@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596109677230_d45dad76ed01a386.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-05.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-05.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn97@2020_6/2020-07-30/1596109677195_4f34cbbc502ceec8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-06.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-06.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn65@2020_2/2020-07-30/1596109673134_c07088445115a093.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/65/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-07.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-07.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn41@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596109672716_3c7fe7b77b121b81.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-08.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-08.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn13@2020_2/2020-07-30/1596109670862_5dd9fd0ef6320604.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-09.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-09.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn13@2020_5/2020-07-30/1596109672411_8adfcdcc6ef22807.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-10-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn77@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596109674707_31ab79ecd12a536a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-11-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn13@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596109676273_99197d49182dadbe.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn58@2020_1/2020-07-30/1596109670855_1d29511d2998f4c4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-13.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn33@2020_3/2020-07-30/1596109676002_ba0e372ff6ec8a07.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-14.jpg/aid5597193-v4-728px-Turn-a-Bookshelf-Into-a-Vertical-Garden-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn66@2020_4/2020-07-30/1596109673618_0d1afab6cf0b29a9.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-07-30 19:47:41","updatedTime":"2020-07-30 11:47:41","title":"How to Try CBD Oil for the First Time","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\"><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Choose-CBD-Oil\" title=\"Choose CBD Oil\">Cannabidiol (CBD) oil</a> is becoming a popular natural treatment for conditions like anxiety, insomnia, and pain. When you’re first trying CBD oil, start by picking the type of CBD product you want to use. Then, choose the right dose for your needs. However, make sure that you’re using CBD oil safely by first checking with your doctor.\n</p>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time&#38;action=edit&#38;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time&#38;action=edit&#38;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Deciding How to Take It\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Deciding-How-to-Take-It\">Deciding How to Take It</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Use a topical CBD oil if you want to treat pain at the site. Massage the CBD oil into your skin if you’re treating aches and pains. Apply a few drops of the oil to the palm of your hand, then rub it into the spot you’re treating. Add more oil as needed to treat the entire area.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-1.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>You may notice pain relief instantly, but it might take 30 minutes for the CBD oil to start working. However, keep in mind that CBD oil may not work for you.</li>\n<li>It’s safe to use as much topical oil as you need to get relief.</li>\n<li>Topical CBD oil may work for up to 5 hours.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li></ul></li>\n<li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Take-CBD-Oil-Under-Your-Tongue\" title=\"Take CBD Oil Under Your Tongue\">Use a tincture</a> for quick relief of anxiety, insomnia, or widespread pain. A tincture may start working in as little as 15-30 minutes. Measure out 1 dose of tincture using the eyedropper that came with your product and squeeze the drops under your tongue. Hold the tincture under your tongue for 30 seconds before swallowing it.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-2.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Your tincture may come in a spray bottle. If this is the case, apply 1 spritz to the inside of each cheek.</li>\n<li>Tinctures often come in flavors, so look for 1 that appeals to you.</li>\n<li>If CBD oil works for you, the benefits of the tincture should last for up to 2-4 hours.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Take CBD oil capsules for an easy, convenient option. CBD oil capsules ensure you get the same dosage each time, but they may take longer to work since they have to go through your digestive system. Read the label on your CBD capsules to find the right dose. Then, take your CBD capsules as directed.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-3.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>If CBD oil works for you, the capsules may start working in 30 minutes. However, it could take as long as 2-4 hours to feel the results. Typically, the benefits of CBD oil capsules last for 4-6 hours.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li></ul></li>\n<li>Experiment with <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-CBD-Edibles\" title=\"Get CBD Edibles\">edibles</a> if you can wait 2-4 hours to feel the effects. CBD edibles are a fun, easy option for trying CBD oil. While they take longer to work than other delivery methods, they also provide longer-lasting effects. Choose CBD edibles that are tasty to you. Check the label on the product to ensure you consume the right serving size.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-04.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 04.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-04.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-04.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Serving sizes may be small for some edibles. For instance, 1-2 gummies or candies is a normal serving size for CBD treats.</li>\n<li>If CBD oil works for you, edibles may provide benefits for up to 4-6 hours.</li></ul></li></ol>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time&#38;action=edit&#38;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Finding the Right Dose\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Finding-the-Right-Dose\">Finding the Right Dose</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Check the dosage instructions if you’re using a commercial product. Read the label on your CBD product to get the dosage recommendation for the product you’re using. Then, follow the manufacturer’s dosage recommendations to use the product safely.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-05.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 05.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-05.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-05.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>If there’s a dosage range, start with the lowest recommended dose and slowly increase your dose until you find one that works for you.</li>\n<li>If your product container doesn’t have a dosage recommendation, visit the company’s website or check with a local dispensary.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Experiment to find the best dose for your needs. There’s no standard dose for CBD oil, and everyone’s body is different. You may need to try different dosage amounts to find what works for you. Start with the lowest recommended dose for the product you're using to see how it affects you. Then, slowly increase your dose until you find what works for you. <sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-6.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Since the bioavailability of CBD oil can vary, it’s likely that you’ll absorb some products better than others. You may need to adjust your dosage depending on the product you’re using.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Use the smallest dosage that provides the benefits you want. Fortunately, you won’t overdose on CBD oil, so you don’t need to worry about taking too much. However, there are side effects that can occur with high dosages, such as stomach aches, irritability, and extreme fatigue. To help you get the benefits you want with minimal risk of side effects, stick to the lowest dose that works for you.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-7.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>It’s unlikely that you’ll develop a tolerance to CBD oil. However, it’s okay to increase your dose if you feel like you’re no longer noticing the benefits of the CBD.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Ask your doctor for the best dose to treat a medical condition. Your doctor may be your best resource for helping your find the right CBD oil dose for you. Talk to your doctor about what you want to use CBD oil to treat. Then, ask them for their dosage recommendation for your unique needs.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-08.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 08.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2f/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-08.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-08.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Your doctor may recommend a brand or delivery method that’s best for your needs.</li></ul></li></ol>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time&#38;action=edit&#38;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Using CBD Oil Safely\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-CBD-Oil-Safely\">Using CBD Oil Safely</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Talk to your doctor before using CBD oil. While CBD oil is generally safe, it’s not right for everyone. It can interact with some medications and might worsen certain conditions. Check with your doctor before using any CBD products to make sure they’re safe for you.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-09.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 09.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-09.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-09.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Explain what you’re using the CBD oil to treat so your doctor can give you their best advice.</li>\n<li>Tell your doctor about any medications you’re already taking and if you’re pregnant or nursing.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Call your doctor if you experience side effects. Although it's rare, you might experience side effects while using CBD oil, especially when taking a high dose. These side effects usually go away quickly, so you don't need to worry. However, it’s best to check with your doctor if you notice the following side effects:<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Drowsiness</li>\n<li>Fatigue</li>\n<li>Dry mouth</li>\n<li>Diarrhea</li>\n<li>Reduced Appetite</li></ul></li>\n<li>Buy products from a reputable supplier. Before you purchase a CBD product, research the supplier to make sure they have good reviews and a professional website. In addition, review any third-party lab reports to ensure you know exactly what's in the product you're using. Because CBD is not FDA-regulated, it's important to use your best judgement when selecting the product you want to try.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-10.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>If you have friends who use CBD oil, ask them which products they recommend.</li>\n<li>Your doctor or pharmacist may also be able to recommend a product for you.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Use CBD oil at home until you know how it affects you. CBD will not get you high, but it could make you feel very tired. You may even fall asleep easily. When you first start using CBD oil, choose a time when you know you’ll be safe at home and don’t have any pressing responsibilities.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup><div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Try CBD Oil for the First Time Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-11.jpg/aid11554424-v4-728px-Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>For instance, you don’t want to try it at work and end up asleep at your desk.</li></ul></li></ol>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time&#38;action=edit&#38;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time&#38;action=edit&#38;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2>\n<ul><li>Although CBD oil is legal in many areas, it’s still illegal in some locations. Check the laws where you live before purchasing CBD products.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li></ul>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time&#38;action=edit&#38;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2>\n<ul><li>Always check with your doctor before using CBD oil to make sure it’s safe for you. This is especially important if you’re taking any medications or have a medical condition.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li></ul>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time&#38;action=edit&#38;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Try-CBD-Oil-for-the-First-Time&#38;action=edit&#38;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2><div class=\"mw-references-wrap id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a rel=\"nofollow\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.health.harvard.edu/blog/cannabidiol-cbd-what-we-know-and-what-we-dont-2018082414476\">https://www.health.harvard.edu/blog/cannabidiol-cbd-what-we-know-and-what-we-dont-2018082414476</a></span>\n</li>\n<li
